@description.name: @description
@description.body: A window widget More information can be found in the package description {@link qx.ui.window}.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: statusbar {qx.ui.container.Composite} statusbar container which shows the statusbar text
@childControl.description: statusbar container which shows the statusbar text

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: pane {qx.ui.container.Composite} window pane which holds the content
@childControl.description: window pane which holds the content

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: captionbar {qx.ui.container.Composite} Container for all widgets inside the captionbar
@childControl.description: Container for all widgets inside the captionbar

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: icon {qx.ui.basic.Image} icon at the left of the captionbar
@childControl.description: icon at the left of the captionbar

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: minimize-button {qx.ui.form.Button} button to minimize the window

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: restore-button {qx.ui.form.Button} button to restore the window

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: maximize-button {qx.ui.form.Button} button to maximize the window

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: close-button {qx.ui.form.Button} button to close the window

@param.name: @param
@param.body: icon {String?} The URL of the caption bar icon
@param.description: The URL of the caption bar icon

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired before the window is closed. The close action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the window is closed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired before the window is minimize. The minimize action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the window is minimized

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired before the window is maximize. The maximize action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the window is maximized

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired before the window is restored from a minimized or maximized state. The restored action can be prevented by calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault} on the event object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the window is restored from a minimized or maximized state

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If the window is active, only one window in a single qx.ui.window.Manager could have set this to true at the same time.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the window be always on top

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the window be modal (this disables minimize and maximize buttons)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The text of the caption

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The icon of the caption

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The text of the statusbar

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the close button be shown

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the maximize button be shown

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the minimize button be shown

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the user have the ability to close the window

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the user have the ability to maximize the window

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the user have the ability to minimize the window

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the statusbar be shown

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether this window should be automatically centered when it appears

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether this window should be automatically centered when its container is resized.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Should the window be automatically destroyed when it is closed. When false, closing the window behaves like hiding the window. When true, the window is removed from its container (the root), all listeners are removed, the window's widgets are removed, and the window is destroyed. NOTE: If any widgets that were added to this window require special clean-up, you should listen on the 'close' event and remove and clean up those widgets there.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the top edge is resizable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the right edge is resizable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the bottom edge is resizable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the left edge is resizable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property group to configure the resize behaviour for all edges at once

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The tolerance to activate resizing

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether a frame replacement should be used during the resize sequence

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget is movable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to use a frame instead of the original widget during move sequences

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Top padding of the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Right padding of the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Bottom padding of the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Left padding of the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The 'contentPadding' property is a shorthand property for setting 'contentPaddingTop', 'contentPaddingRight', 'contentPaddingBottom' and 'contentPaddingLeft' at the same time. If four values are specified they apply to top, right, bottom and left respectively. If there is only one value, it applies to all sides, if there are two or three, the missing values are taken from the opposite side.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Integer} Original top value before maximation had occurred

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Integer} Original left value before maximation had occurred

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Integer} Listener ID for centering on appear

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Integer} Listener ID for centering on resize

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The children container needed by the {@link qx.ui.core.MRemoteChildrenHandling} mixin

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Updates the status and the visibility of each element of the captionbar.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Close the current window instance. Simply calls the {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#hide} method if the {@link qx.ui.win.Window#autoDestroy} property is false; otherwise removes and destroys the window.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Open the window.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Centers the window to the parent. This call works with the size of the parent widget and the size of the window as calculated in the last layout flush. It is best to call this method just after rendering the window in the "resize" event: 

   win.addListenerOnce("resize", this.center, this);

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Maximize the window.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Minimized the window.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Restore the window to "normal", if it is "maximized" or "minimized".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the window's position relative to its parent

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return true if the window is in maximized state, but note that the window in maximized state could also be invisible, this is equivalent to minimized. So use the {@link qx.ui.window.Window#getMode} to get the window mode.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the window is maximized, false otherwise.
@return.description: true if the window is maximized, false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the window mode as String: "maximized", "normal" or "minimized".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the element, to which the content padding should be applied.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops every event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Focuses the window instance.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listens to the "focusout" event to deactivate the window (if the currently focused widget is not a child of the window)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Maximizes the window or restores it if it is already maximized.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Minimizes the window, removes all states from the minimize button and stops the further propagation of the event (calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#stopPropagation}).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Restores the window, removes all states from the restore button and stops the further propagation of the event (calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#stopPropagation}).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Maximizes the window, removes all states from the maximize button and stops the further propagation of the event (calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#stopPropagation}).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Closes the window, removes all states from the close button and stops the further propagation of the event (calling {@link qx.event.type.Event#stopPropagation}).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Forward the call with the given function name to the children container

@param.name: @param
@param.body: functionName {String} name of the method to forward
@param.description: name of the method to forward

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a1 {var?} first argument of the method to call
@param.description: first argument of the method to call

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a2 {var?} second argument of the method to call
@param.description: second argument of the method to call

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a3 {var?} third argument of the method to call
@param.description: third argument of the method to call

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The return value of the forward method
@return.description: The return value of the forward method

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the children list

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.core.LayoutItem[]} The children array (Arrays are
   reference types, please do not modify them in-place)
@return.description:
The children array (Arrays are
   reference types, please do not modify them in-place)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget contains children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns true when the widget has children.
@return.description: Returns true when the widget has children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a new child widget. The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the given child item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} An array containing the removed children.
@return.description: An array containing the removed children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given item if it is a child item. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.
@return.description: The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a child at the specified index This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the item will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add an item before another already inserted item This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: before {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item before the new item will be inserted.
@param.description: item before the new item will be inserted.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add an item after another already inserted item This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: after {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item, after which the new item will be inserted
@param.description: item, after which the new item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the item at the specified index. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the item to remove.
@param.description: Index of the item to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set a layout manager for the widget. A a layout manager can only be connected with one widget. Reset the connection with a previous widget first, if you like to use it in another widget instead.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: layout {qx.ui.layout.Abstract} The new layout or null to reset the layout.
@param.description: The new layout or null to reset the layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the widget's layout manager.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the widget, which draws the resize/move frame. The resize frame is shared by all widgets and is added to the root widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates, shows and syncs the frame with the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Computes the new boundaries at each interval of the resize sequence.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the computed boundaries
@return.description: A map with the computed boundaries

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Roll handler which prevents the scrolling via tap & move on parent widgets during the move of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enables the capturing of the caption bar and prepares the drag session and the appearance (translucent, frame or opaque) for the moving of the window.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Does the moving of the window by rendering the position of the window (or frame) at runtime using direct dom methods.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Disables the capturing of the caption bar and moves the window to the last position of the drag session. Also restores the appearance of the window.

@description.name: @description
